page.title: 17THE CHURCHES OF WARMINSTER
page.content: Warminster has 8 churches. Canon Johnson, Vicar of the largest church, St Denys, runs 10 services a week and sees an average Sunday attendance of 105-135. Among his special services in 1984 were 20 weddings, 40 funerals, 45 christenings and 20 confirmations. The congregations include all ages: the old outnumber the young but many young people take part in Sunday Schools and Church Youth Clubs. Warminster has several choirs, and Churches run many other activities, from women's groups to bell ringing. Ministers go into schools, visit the sick and play an active part in the community. Recently the local United Reformed Church had to amalgamate with the Methodists due to a declining congregation, but Canon Johnson, speaking from 17 years' experience as Vicar,believes that the Churches have a flourishing future.
